snippet: Western foreign correspondents - Peter Arnett, the Pulitzer Prize-winning war correspondent among them - are increasingly becoming university professors in China, in a nation that wants international expertise but also grapples with its own issues...
abstract: Western foreign correspondents - Peter Arnett, the Pulitzer Prize-winning war correspondent among them - are increasingly becoming university professors in China, in a nation that wants international expertise but also grapples with its own issues with free speech.

headline.main: The Tension of Teaching Journalism in China
